conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Point A is connected to a purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the flow from A downward and to the right.
The flow from A will be directed towards the right side of the image.
Point B is connected to a yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the flow from B downward and to the left.
The flow from B will be directed towards the left side of the image.
Point C is connected to a blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the flow from C downward and to the right.
The flow from C will be directed towards the right side of the image.
The flow from A and C will both be directed towards the right side of the image.
The flow from B will be directed towards the left side of the image.
Container D is located on the left side of the image.
Container E is located on the right side of the image.
Since the flow from A and C is directed towards the right side, it will flow into Container E.
The flow from B is directed towards the left side, so it will flow into Container D.
The liquid from points A and C will flow into Container E.
The liquid from point B will flow into Container D.
